title: Audacity
description: If you are interested in making a podcast, you need software to help you edit and arrange your sound files. Audacity is free, open source, cross-platform audio software.
contents:
What is Audacity?
How to get started
To use Audacity, you first need to download it onto your personal computer.
Visit https: //www.audacityteam.org/
Click the blue “Download Audacity” button and complete the installation process.
Open Audacity.
Need more help?
For the manual, visit https://manual.audacityteam.org/. Links to various tutorials are on this page, including “Editing an Audio File”, “Your First Recording”, and “Mixing Voice with Background Music”.
Further questions?
Request an appointment: https://www.slu.edu/arts-and-sciences/ong-center/book-appointment.php

title: Doccano Public Facing Deployment Tutorial
description: Docanno is a piece of open source software that enables crowdsourcing document annotation for machine learning and other useful tasks.
contents:
Install Doccano, Git, and Docker
Navigate to https://github.com/doccano/doccano
install git and docker-cli
fork https://github.com/doccano/doccano
git clone your fork of doccano
cd into cloned project
create .env in root of cloned project with the following contents:
Update Your Environment Settings (.env file in path)
Platform settings
ADMIN_USERNAME=admin
ADMIN_PASSWORD=password
ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@example.com
Blah
rabbit mq settings
RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_USER=doccano
RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_PASS=doccano
Postgres settings
database settings
POSTGRES_USER=doccano
POSTGRES_PASSWORD=doccano
POSTGRES_DB=doccano
Deploy Your App
Create Webapp
run this command in your terminal docker-compose -f docker/docker-compose.prod.yml –env-file .env up, then access http://127.0.0.1/
Inspect to see working
Deploy to Host
then click “Deploy to Heroku” button. Which will take you to heroku, create free account, go back to git project and click deploy button again
site will run after 10 minutes or so
To add Users
https://yourwebsite.herokuapp.com/admin/

title: Poop
description: A short description of the post.
contents:
Distill is a publication format for scientific and technical writing, native to the web.
Learn more about using Distill at https://rstudio.github.io/distill.
